intro: Podosemum capillare, commonly known as the slender podosemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant has opposite, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
